body_html:
This adds more API surface without any improvement in functionality. T* can always be used in a place that accepts const T* and the const-ness of a Tensor smart pointer doesn't imply immutability.

For comparison STL smart pointers only define T* get() (not a const T* variant)

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/unique_ptr/get
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/get
body_text:
This adds more API surface without any improvement in functionality. T* can always be used in a place that accepts const T* and the const-ness of a Tensor smart pointer doesn't imply immutability.
For comparison STL smart pointers only define T* get() (not a const T* variant)
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/unique_ptr/get
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/get
body:
This adds more API surface without any improvement in functionality. `T*` can always be used in a place that accepts `const T*` and the const-ness of a Tensor smart pointer doesn't imply immutability.

For comparison STL smart pointers only define `T* get()` (not a `const T*` variant)

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/unique_ptr/get
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/shared_ptr/get
